intro: Oudneya, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its striking, often bioluminescent flowers that appear to glow in the dark. These plants are native to various regions in Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. Oudneya species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Their unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make them an intriguing subject for botanical study.
